website_summaries.verdict: This Alexa-compatible plug-in smart dimmer gets the job done, but alternatives from Belkin, Lifx, and Philips Hue are all more fully featured, and more cost effective, too.
pros: The Decora plug-in dimmer is easy to use, and it works well with Alexa to let you dim your lamps up and down using voice commands
The My Leviton app is well-designed, with plenty of controls for automating your lights or customizing things like fade duration
cons: The dimmer's bulky design blocks off any outlets below it, and you'll need to plug your lamp into the bottom of the device, which can be a little awkward
There also aren't any significant third-party integrations beyond Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Can not rely on it
customer_reviews.text: Installation and set up are fine. The only gap in the features is that there’s no random on/off timing. But the big problem is that it works one week, then is broken the next week, and then it works again. When it is “broken”, it is not just the internet/phone control, but even physically pushing the button doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.author: AboveClouds

customer_reviews.title: flaky
customer_reviews.text: had 3 installed recently: 1 works perfect, with 2 FEIT LED lights connected to it 2nd one flickers until fully on, and flickers when dimming. 6 FEIT LES lights connected to it 3rd one is wired with the matching remote (3 ways switch) and only turns the lights off/on. does not dim. 4 FEIT LED lights connected to it. ALL LED lights are identical. Called Leviton and they want to know the model of the lights to check for compatibility. ...even though they are all the same and work fine on one of the switches, so I would think that it shouldn't matter... currently waiting for the information form my electrician.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah Dude

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year with no support or warranty
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I bought these in Nov, 2017 and in about 13 months it died on me. Leviton was unable to work by warranty claim. Chat is "not able" to process warranty claims. Phone support level 1 diagnosed it as dead and transferred me to level 2 support which was basically me on hold for over 20 minutes at which point I had to hang up and continue with my day.
customer_reviews.author: Sid S

customer_reviews.title: There are a few important things to know before you buy this switch
customer_reviews.text: Some things it doesn't tell you before you buy this. You have to download the correct app on your App Store and then connect the smart switch through the app. To get Alexa to control the switch, you have to enable the Leviton skill. Also if you are not 100% sure about your light switches, open your light switch box and make sure you have all 4 wires available. Also the switch comes with a interchangeable rocker plate, it comes with white and light almond choice. If you are putting 2 switches in one box don't forget to buy the 2-gang rocker face plate in the color you want.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Smart dimmer for the win!
customer_reviews.text: Love my smart switch/dimmer! Installed very easily. Note, that you must have a neutral/ground wire in order to install. I set it up with Google Home so I can say "Ok Google, turn on/off my lights." It works great and my even my non-techie dad uses it with no problem. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Deus

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our deck lights
customer_reviews.text: EDIT AFTER 1 YEAR: Still works great! I highly recommend this. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I am using this plug to go with the string lights on our back deck (see pictures). Pros: Easy install Dimming feature 100% functional WiFi reception is good, even through a exterior brick wall and some thick steel. Alexa integration was easy. Just follow the steps to get the Leviton app, detect the plug and integrate it into the Alexa app. Cons: Pretty much none. Have experienced 0 issues, even with it being outside under cover. This actually works well. We shall see how long it lasts outside (under cover) during an Alabama summer and winter. For now, I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Cole

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Can no longer recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had about 10 of these switches installed in my house for about a year now, along with >50 dimmers. The dimmers remain pretty stable. But, these switches are now constantly dropping off the network and freezing up - cannot even manually turn the lights on/off with the toggle. Currently using firmware 1.4.12;CP 1.9. If the next firmware doesn’t fix this, I’ll be looking for a new manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: David Cates

customer_reviews.title: It Really Really Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: It Really Really Works!!! After searching, buying, and testing several like items, I finally found a SMART Wi-Fi Plug-in!!! Setup of the Leviton DW3HL-1BW ( Smart Plug-in is simple. The download of the Leviton App and linking to Amazon Alexa couldn't have been easier. Now I can set & DIM the lights on our pergola with our Amazon Echo Dot -  or our Smartphone. The lights on the pergola are '48 Ft Amber LED Outdoor String Lights with 15 Lights -  ... The Leviton DW3HL-1BW perfectly DIMs the outdoor lights to any level we choose - simply by telling Alexa "Turn On Outdoor Lights" or "DIM Outdoor Lights to 30%"...... Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Maria and Ken

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have had these a year. They have become totally unresponsive requiring a breaker reset to bring them back. Even the factory reset procedure doesn’t work when they are down. Check reviews before buying these. You will see LOTS of unhappy customers. And their support is just as bad.
customer_reviews.author: Al Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: replacing a similar style dimmer with this one for the WiFi capabilities and ability to us my Amazon Echo...set up was a little difficult more complicated than the one I Was replacing. Wasn't hard but took me a minute to figure out that I needed to create a bridge from the white/neutral to the switch. Once I did that everything was working perfectly. App set up and echo connect was easy and straght forward. Nothing fancy and straight forward with customization. Currently operates 4 led can/recessed lights. Pleased that I made the switch. No longer ordering my kids to adjust the lighting lol
customer_reviews.author: Rashon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. But instructions for pairing this with Alexa ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. But instructions for pairing this with Alexa were poor. It took many attempts to get the Leviton app to connect to the device, but once that happened, it has worked great. I ended up using an alternative WiFi access point for this dimmer as the Leviton app always failed at the last step of the pairing process on my main WiFi access point.
customer_reviews.author: W. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Don't Recommend - get Lutron Caseta
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Ordered 6 to start converting all my switches and they are horrible. Constantly losing wifi which is frustrating when synced with alexa. I like that they remember last level of dimming verse the lutron caseta but if you are using Alexa to turn on, no big deal as you just tell Alexa what % to turn on. I switched all to lutron caseta switches. More reliable. I think using a hub creates more reliability but take a pass on these. In addition, one switch completely failed within the year. They did replace it, but coupled with connectivity issues, I would give these zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Can  be used to voice control outside lights
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget. Very easy to setup. I'm using it to control outside "cafe style" (vintage Edison light bulbs) led string lights that benefit from dimming capability. It's small enough to fit inside some external outlet boxes that helps to ensure protection against the elements (link:. It's awesome to be able to use an Echo devide to voice activate and dim outside deck lights without having to fumble for a remote or have to walk to the box or have to have an android device around to access the app. This is also sold at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Netter

customer_reviews.title: One of the most advanced, and to date the best wifi dimmer on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: I investigated and even installed other brands, but ultimately decided on the Leviton Wifi Dimmer both for its wifi connectivity as well as the fact that it easily integrated with my other Leviton smart switches through the "My Leviton" phone app. One additional advantage to the Leviton brand dimmer was that it allowed my LED lights to be dimmed to a considerably lower brightness than the other devices that I tried. I've had other Leviton smart switches installed for well over a year now, without any problems whatsoever. They are easy to install, they are easy to 'connect' to your wifi router and add to the phone app. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A. Higbee

customer_reviews.title: Schedule relative to sunrise/sunset
customer_reviews.text: Huge advantage over other smart outlets....the ability to schedule on/off "relative" to sunrise or sunset....+/- 120 minutes earlier or later. Since sunrise and sunset are moving targets....~2 minutes per day for each...this is a great feature that my other less smart outlets don't have. I have many smart devices from other manufacturers, all of them can schedule using sunrise/sunset, but not to a relative time. Installation took about 2 minutes....another minute to link to Amazon Alexa app. Done. If you don't need the relative scheduling feature, TP-Link has a wider assortment of smart outlets, including ones that monitor/track power usage over time. I have a lot of TP-Link outets, and wish they had this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works in my detached garage about 60' from my router
customer_reviews.text: Was Easy to wire and setup. Had another internet switch which did not work. Maybe I'll even buy an Echo Dot, but for now it works great via my IPad and Iphone. If it stops working someday I'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: Only way to upgrade your home to a Smart Home
customer_reviews.text: Last year we purchased a home and one of my first tasks was to upgrade the house to a Smart House. I have purchased nearly 20 different Leviton devices, to control our lighting - from three-way dimmer switches, WiFi and Alexa enabled, programming it to routines to automatically turn-on and turn-off the lights, to the decorative wall plates. I even installed the Leviton USB wall switches in strategic locations. Everyone that comes over to the house come with their Smartphones and it isn't long before someone asks for a charger. Now, they just have to go to the switch and plug in - great solution...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Let there be light
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these smart dimmer wall switches, one for our dining room and one for our family room. They are fantastic. The dimming function works just as well as with regular dimmer switches, and I love having the option of controlling them through the app and through Alexa (Amazon Echo device). Be advised that, as it says in the product description, a neutral wire is required for installation. Our previous switch wasn't connected to a neutral wire but we were able to rig it. If you don't have expereince with electrical work you should let a pro install it for you.
customer_reviews.author: jpevball9

customer_reviews.title: It is ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and it somewhat works. It is cloud connected which I am not sure I really like. I put it on an isolated guest network but still not trilled by the possibility that someone could play around with my lights. I noticed two issues that may be related: - My load is 230W and this thing is warm, very warm (but not hot) - There is a hum coming from it when the lights are on. Definitely audible from a couple of feet away in a quiet room. As my first smart switch it is interesting to play with it. The app is OK and the integration with Google Assistant works.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Great For Scheduling Lights To Turn On And Off
customer_reviews.text: I have a few outdoor lights and before I had to manually turn them on and off the light twice a day (sunrise / sunset) because they don't have a photocell. With this light switch you can easy program it to turn on and off automatically when the sun rises and sets which most other smart light switches can't do. It uses your zip code and knows when the sun sets and rises, so cool! I recommend having an electrician install it if you don't know what you are doing. Also it gets a little warm as well, not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Once I Configured Correctly for My Situation
customer_reviews.text: I have dual channel Xfinity Wi-Fi and once I disabled the 5 ghz channel the five Leviton DW15P-1BW Decora Smart Wi-Fi Mini Plug-In Outlets I purchased now work without any problems on the 2.4 ghz channel. They no longer drop out and when I cut the power several times to test, they reconnected with no issues. The 5 ghz Wi-Fi signal is short range and won't go through walls very well. I really don't need the 5 ghz signal but if I ever do I'll have to add a network mesh for signal coverage. I'm very happy with the purchase, especially that it does not require a hub.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Whidby, CPA

customer_reviews.title: Security danger - personal info needed to use switch
customer_reviews.text: In order to use the app to control the switch, you must set up an account with personal info - name, email, etc. Once they have this, they are very few restictions on how they can use your data. And they can go thrrough your computer/phone for any other info they feel like as long as you have the app. Why do you need that just to control a switch inside a private network inside your house? This is a HUGE security risk, one that is completely unecessary. Sending it back unopened
customer_reviews.author: Experienced

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Easy to connect to wifi. Easy to configure. Amazingly simple integration with Google Home and Google Assistant -- and it all works! Works well as both a smart switch and as a manual switch. It's a high quality piece of equipment. Having seen this one, I wouldn't even consider one of the (barley) cheaper no-name switches. One of the best designed apps I've used -- of any kind. Easy to use. Responds quickly. Easy to set up even complicated situations. Kudos to the development team.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hadaller

customer_reviews.title: They work as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these switches connected to alexa. I have the ability to control them individually or as a group through the leviton app as well as through alexa. I have an echo and a dot and either will control the lights. It is great not having to worry about smart bulbs or hubs. I have wired my switches in the past. It was a little odd adding the white wire into the equation but it only took five minutes to get everything hooked up. I would highly recommend these switches.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph MS

customer_reviews.title: No 2.4\5ghz with the same SSID (normal practice)
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work with 2.4 and 5 with the same SSID! Trouble came when I upgraded my wifi. New router gives incredible speed when I'm close and the fringes of my house my clients drop back to the 2.4 only and have decent speed. Well everything I own except for the switch. Tech support said to make different names but wtf all my other phones and devices have no prob?? After a year or more the Lev app says a new firmware update is available. I do it and the new firmware number is the same?? I'm putting my neg review here so there's some kind of incentive for leviton to make good.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Nadler

customer_reviews.title: Works reliably and very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Works great - The overhead light switch for a patio room is in the house but I have an Alexa that works well to operate it without walking to it. Like all WiFi items, (at least mine), they drop off the Wifi for a while. This switch does it less so and is quick to reconnect without help. It is a bit of a pain to cram into the wall box but it's working. It does feel warm in the wall, but then it's a WiFi device so that's normal. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FogShark

customer_reviews.title: It’s like magic
customer_reviews.text: I love this product when it works, which it does most of the time. But when it doesn’t work then it is infuriating. I use it to power and control a torchiere lamp. From time to time Leviton’s web server is down which means no control and I’m in the dark. Leviton needs to work on reliability of their web operation. Otherwise this is a great product that allowed me to bring an old lamp into the 21st century for a little over $30.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. Marotta

customer_reviews.title: ... I won by this again and I would not recommend it to
customer_reviews.text: I can't give it any thing more it is awful the customer service at leviton well not back the product for six weeks now the switch has lost connections on and off now it has gone completely dead less than 6 months of ownership I have to go up and down the steps to throw the circuit breaker to turn the lights on and off in my bedroom and after 15 emails they finally said last Thursday they would replace it they still haven't sent it it's now the following Thursday I won by this again and I would not recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only smart plug I could find that connects with Google wifi
customer_reviews.text: Google wifi is great but it decides whether to use 5 ghz or 2.4 ghz band. Other brand plugs simply would not connect because they only used 2.4 band and I could not trick Google wifi into using anything but 5 ghz. The leviton plug connected with no problem and has been working flawlessly to turn on/off a light for several months. No dropped connections - it is rock solid. Looked at the app features but decided to use the Alexa app instead, also without problems. Highly recommend and well worth the price premium.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install, easy to configure, ordering more!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to install, configure and use. I put it on the front porch light, and programmed it to come in at sunset and turn off around eleven. Very simple to do. Going to add more for other exterior lights. The switch itself is very durable, sleek, and fully operational in case you want to go old school and actually touch your light switch. Telling Alexa to turn off the front porch light is a hoot, but I don't know how often I'll use it. Then again, I'm pretty lazy... Coolest thing so far was turning on the light while away from the house. Kids think I'm a genius hacker now, which is kinda funny.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Smart Home Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I've been upgrading my condo to a smart home. I have an Alexa controlled thermometer and wanted my lights to be controlled as well. I had recessed LED lights installed throughout and had an electrician install these smart dimmers. I love them! Just download the Alexa app & I can control through my Dot or on my phone when I'm not home. Also I can have them dimmed by voice. I never need to leave my sofa again. Dimmers are confusing to install, so best to have an electrician do it. I can install normal switches myself, but this was a bit confusing.
customer_reviews.author: MsChief

customer_reviews.title: Once you go smart switch you won't go back, and you'll want more!
customer_reviews.text: Love these switches. Setup is fairly easy. Light dims up to your previous setting smoothly, same with off. Loads of customization: set timers for daily routines, easily switch routines, modes. Even the rate of speed it dims on/off! Forgot to shut off your lights... Hundreds of miles away... No problem so long as your internet is working, click off on your phone or if you have schedules setup it will change accordingly away from home. Helps make people think you are home when lights turn on randomly too! One complaint is that they fit a bit tight in older outlet boxes, but with skill it can still be installed in most cases.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Switches don’t work with LED lights
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to work on our renovated house. Bought early - so we would have them when the contractor needed them. Just installed them - found out they don’t work with LED lights (which are required). Not only do they don’t dim - they don’t even turn on or off the lights. Contacted customer support - after 30 min on hold - they rushed me off the phone after telling me the LED lights are the problem. Title 24 in california requires LEF. We are out of return window. Very expensive light switches that don’t work. Don’t buy these if you use LEF lights
customer_reviews.author: Dozey Don

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We used these dimmer switches for our outdoor patio buildout, after researching all types. It was a fairly easy install. The modules were slightly large, to fit into small spaces, but we were able to fit it well. The software app, downloaded, presented a slight challenge at first; but since installed, it works exceptionally well. We love it! WELL WORTH the purchase. Even though we have already installed 4 of them; we will definitely buy it again, for additional areas.
customer_reviews.author: Carde3nde

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install and life-changing convenience
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems installing and getting these switches (I have two dimmers and five standard WIFI wall switches) installed, connected to WIFI and working with Alexa (AND Google Home, by the way). I love the convenience of being able to have either assistant turn off "Front of house" and the recessed lights on the front porch and the lights by the street and the lights on the garage all go off. And being able to turn them on from inside my car??? AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Scott

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Device for the Smart Home Starter!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, easy to use smart home device for beginners! I was a little nervous, since this was my first attempt at doing any smart home configuration, but this product is the perfect "starter" piece for the uninitiated! Just plug in the module to the receptacle, plug into the receptacle what you want to switch, and set up control on your phone. The most time-consuming part of the process was hunting down my wifi password. Foolproof setup steps through the app, easy tap on/off switching, and it works flawlessly. I can even switch off the light I'm controlling from across the house! I'm looking forward to incorporating more from the Decora Smart series into my increasingly smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Jensen

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Google capable dimmers I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these that I've installed around our house and I have to say that they function perfectly 95% of the time, (which is way better than all the other brands I've bought). On 2 occasions over the past 2-1/2 years I've tried to turn on lights and received a message back from Google that "Leviton is unavailabe at this time" causing me to have to manually operate my light switch. Those were secluded events. Typically I can set intensity and turn lights off with no problem simply by asking Google, using my Samsung app or Google Home app. The only thing I'd want to change is the price but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgerunner

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect except for buzzing and 3-way problems
customer_reviews.text: Overall - Decent but annoying issues that need to be resolved before the switches are perfect (would be 10/10 if below cons are resolved!). Pros: Easy to setup; iOS app works well - its intuitive, and allows for a high level of customization; aesthetically more attractive than other wifi-enabled smart switches Cons: Buzzing sound coming from switch and lights; Issues with lights that have another light switch - may need to replace the other switch as well, or light will not function... need to figure out how to resolve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Leviton Smart switches and 1 remote switch. This product is top. Extremely easy to install and the setup was a breeze. I never loose the connection and the Leviton app sets up these switch’s perfectly. The app also provides a very easy way to setup and maintain light schedules. The Amazon Alexa integration into this switch allows me to communicate easily with Alexa to turn lights on and off. I could not be happier with the quality and easy of use with the Leviton app. Thanks Amazon & Leviton for a job well done.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Switch with support to backup the product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dimmer switch. Connects to 2.4 or 5G Wifi Networks. Easy to use and setup. No need for a hub, just connects to your WIFI network. The App works great and if there are any firmware updates, it can be upgraded within the App. When I needed support for this device or other devices I've purchased from Leviton, there support has been great. Nice to have a company that backs up there products with great support!!..
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like it. One of the few dim-able smart outlets available. If you intend to put a smart-bulb in a lamp that can get knocked off the table a bit too often, use one of these. (I still love you, Mom!) Will do a fan, too. I put it on an extension cord so it's off the wall, where I can reach it if I need to. (It has an on/off button on it, also.) Was originally purchased for a 5-bulb chandelier. Will probably buy another.
customer_reviews.author: 516-Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Functionality
customer_reviews.text: Works great once you program the device to work thru Levitons app and separately if you want to voice control thru let's say Google Assistant. You do need a small level of tech savvy to get these units up and running and synced into your wifi. It may take a couple of trys, but they always work once programed. You then can also set events such as on at dusk off at dawn along with the brightness levels and the fade in and out levels. Good product with no need to attach another hub to your, I'm sure, already messy back of computer wiring. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pershin

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and easy to use once wired up correctly (which is key) and the right product is in place. We thought the three way switch was not working the other day and realized the toggle switch across the room was used to turn the lights off and they remained off as a result. While you could flip the old switch and try to keep it there, it's best best if you buy this product with the accompanying Matching switch remote so the old switch does not wreak havoc with your smart systems.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Earnest Inman

customer_reviews.title: Great switches, I'm adding to every room.
customer_reviews.text: Great app, great Alexa integration. I turn lights on and off by voice at home and by app when I'm away. New Alexa 'guard' mode smartly turn lights on and off based on our real life usage and not just sunrise/sunset. I am slowly replacing one switch in every room to these devices. Install is pretty easy if you are comfortable with basic home wiring. Check out help online videos for help.
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Great for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these to control switches for roof heating cables.. I travel to florida in the winter, and when it snows up here, I want to turn the cables on, then off after the snow. this wasnt possible till I got these switches. They were easy to install and set up and conneted to wifi in less than a minute. This will make it easy to not have to leave these cables on for weeks when I am in florida. I have Nest cam, so I can see the snow accumulaiton and know when to turn on and off the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome! I've been using it for a week now. Paired it with Alexa. Working flawlessly. No hub required. Installation was fairly easy- the hardest part was trying to fit all the switches in the crowded box. The mobile app is also easy to use. Make sure you have a neutral wire before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: I was able to easily replace my standard dimmer in about 10 min
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a dimmable light switch that didn’t require a hub. This fits the bill. I was able to easily replace my standard dimmer in about 10 min. This does require a neutral wire (#14 or #12). Had to purchase the neutral and ground wire as the old dimmer didn’t have a neutral and the ground was connected to the receptacle. This requires solid copper wire. Downloaded the My Leviton app and enabled the Alexa My Leviton skill. So now I can control via iPad or amazon Echo. Already bought one for my parents living room and will be continuing to replace a few more switches in my house. Definitely a winner.
customer_reviews.author: CityGirl26

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed with Alexa, but dimmer function not as nice as other Levitons
customer_reviews.text: We have both this dimmer and non-Alexa-enabled Leviton dimmers, and this dimmer functions well with Alexa, but the actually dimmer functionality is not as nice as the non-Alexa Leviton dimmer. The non-Alexa dimmers have a nice "transition" function that ramps the brightness from "off" to "on" gradually, and also from "on" to "off". This model ramps from "on" to "off" in the same manner, but the ramp from "off" to "on" jumps straight from "off" to 80%-90% brightness, which appears to your eye to be essentially "off" and "on", like a standard light switch. Like the Alexa functionality, but Leviton should correct the dimmer function to be like their corresponding non-Alexa dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Allison

customer_reviews.title: These dimmer switches are the greatest!
customer_reviews.text: Installed two dimmer switches and they were very easy to install but the best is the app to control lights -- it is a fantastic app and with very little effort -- I now control(off,on and dimmer away from home). So impressed that I ordered another 7 today. I also like the 5 year guarantee and the amount of watts the dimmer can handle(one light has 9 -- 50 watt led bulbs and the switch handles with ease!! I also paired them up to Alexa -- works perfectly -- can not ask for anything more!!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia J Byerly

customer_reviews.title: I have regrets
customer_reviews.text: These work well, when they work. They go on and off line at random. I called Leviton customer service. The representative patiently and cheerfully walked me through the procedure for connection to the wifi (I had tried this several times already), and then she said the problem needed to be passed elsewhere. She said I would get a call. (I never did) Although I never received the call, they mysteriously started working again, for a while. Last week, two of the four I purchased remained offline. When I started this review, all four were online, but as I typed, one went off line. They come, they go.
customer_reviews.author: Inmangroup

customer_reviews.title: Physically easy to install but programming is more difficult
customer_reviews.text: Works with the Google Mini-assistant to turn on/off the lights and dim them. I installed the product and did the wiring. Pretty easy. (If you're not using the switch in a 3-way configuration you should cover the end of the 3-way wire with a wire but. The instructions say to just leave the plastic sleeve on it but the safest way to prevent a short and frying the switch is to take off that end sleeve and secure it inside a wiring nut. Simple to do to protect an expensive smart switch.) l had a genius friend who loves gadgets set up how to use it with the Google Mini. I don't know if I could've done it by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rjlory

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time !
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointing experiment to say the least. I got the switches installed and connected on the first try. After 3 weeks both topped working. I contacted customer support but the switches would not re-enroll even after several factory resets and cutting the power. One of the switches no longer works as a manual switch. I would say that this technology is not ready for prime time. Update 01302019: The second switch became unstuck after another reset. So now it works fine as a manual switch again. Leviton customer service has been very helpful. I am going to keep trying to get these to stabilize and will edit my review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: cobes

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, so far ok, prob will buy more.
customer_reviews.text: The setup was pretty quick and straight-forward. I connected this via my Google Home and almost everything seems to work ok, given Google's integration abilities. - "Ok Google, turn light on": Works - "Ok Google, turn light ON to 20 percent": If you don't say the "ON" portion, the light will be set to 20% but won't actually turn on to it. - "Ok Google, turn light off": Works Want to get a few more for around the house now.....
customer_reviews.author: M. Svensson

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to the wifi
customer_reviews.text: This product will not connect to my wifi. I use Google's wifi and android pixel 3 and the switches will not finish the set up process. I called support and they told me it is because my wifi does not distinguish between the 2.5ghz and 5ghz signal. Well this is all automatic and I have no way of overriding and forcing my phone to connect to the same signal the switch is connecting to. I was told to wait for the next software update and try again. I am hoping leviton will read this and lend a hand and find me a work around. I tried to ask as question but that option was not available.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: works, but buzzing
customer_reviews.text: it works as expected, and smart enough to be controlled by its app, but both having buzzing sounds. Dimmer controls 10 Leds (About 5w each) have very noisy buzzing sound when i stand next to it. Second dimmer controls 5 Leds (Same type as above), also have some kind of buzzing sound, i have to put my ear next to it in order to hear it. Any one noticed same issue as me?
customer_reviews.author: Danzic

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews. BUT DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS. ( WiFi switches) Installed a couple of these and was so impressed that I ordered several more the next day. Once installed the MOST THEY WORK IS 2 DAYS! Then I have to reprogram ALL SWITCHES. When I email tech support all I get is a " auto reply that explains how to update FIRMWARE... Great idea from Leviton..not a good product- follow through..I will update if situation improves . Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Len A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe to install (IF YOU'RE QUALIFIED)
customer_reviews.text: Notes: - This review applies only to Leviton switches on an Alexa system - Installation should be by a qualified electrician. Once installed, and integrated with the Alexa system, they work perfectly. I have replaced all of the switches in my house with these except my garbage disposal. I love it. If I get in bed and forget to turn off the kitchen light, or need to turn on the overhead fan, I just have Alexa do it through my Leviton switches. One note: If you have a power failure, the system will temporarily lose its mind, but it will recover quickly after the power comes back on.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Jack

customer_reviews.title: Unit dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work, my husband set it up as a single pole unit, had power going in and would not turn on the lights no power going out (he used voltage tester). He called tech support and they were not much help, the guy said he was missing a wire even though he explained it was only a single pole and described how it was set up and he confirmed those were all the right wires. Still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Replacing and Iris wall switch that I could never get to work. This needs no hub and connected right up to me home Wi-Fi network and have been working perfectly for several weeks now without a hitch. Great produst!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy. I’m not an electronic wizard so it took a minute for my brain to process the instructions, but it went smoothly. My non dimmable lamp is now disable with this and a dimmable led bulb installed. Works great with Alexa. The app allows you to set timers for the light on and off and even set the brightness when it comes on via timer/schedule. Works as expected and I will be buying a few more for a few other areas of the house.
customer_reviews.author: SeeDub8ch

customer_reviews.title: Best smart switches on the market
customer_reviews.text: I researched may other brands, I am so glad I chose Leviton, the easiest installation, syncing, and use. I originally bought for only a few switches but when I found how great this product was I installed them throughout my house. I can control from anywhere using my smartphone or just tell Alexa too, also they are programmable through their app to schedule lighting on and off times. I highly recommend leviton smart dimmer and switches.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I wish it had a morning alarm function that can turn the lights up slowly maybe like in 1 or 2 mins to full brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sooo easy!
customer_reviews.text: Sooo easy! I'm a self-proclaimed non-techie and I can't believe how easy this was to install! If I could do it anyone else can do it. Just a few wire connections and the dimmer was in and the app was so user friendly and easy to follow to complete the setup. I love how you can set schedules easily and control your lights from your phone. I will definitely be installing more Decora Smart WiFi products in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Kelela

customer_reviews.title: Cust. service line helpful, but installation complicated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smart dimmer along with the matching secondary switch (DD00R-DLZ) for a 3-way set-up. I'm an experienced do-it-yourself-er, but struggled here because the written directions and Leviton's own YouTube video conflicted with one another. Took me multiple install attempts, and two calls to their customer service line to get it working. The phone service was great (after 20min wait to reach a tech associate), but they talked me through it in the end. In all, I probably spent 4 hours on installing two switches. Now that everything is installed properly, both switches work as advertised and are controllable from either switch and the app.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Plug Works GREAT. The app sucks not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It works, but the App sucks! It's Pricier than the other smart adapters we've used but it's the only one we can find that works with AT&T fiber and a 5 gigahertz Wi-Fi gateway. It's a Very solid product. just wish it was cheaper! The only strange thing, is that the green light on the plug illuminates when the switch is off? You would think that would be the opposite??n APL
customer_reviews.author: TarTar

customer_reviews.title: An inconvenient truth
customer_reviews.text: I’m taking this out tomorrow. It was a novel idea that wore out quickly. As soon as it loses its connection and starts flashing like a cop car in the middle of the night every night and you realize what a pain in the a$$ it is to reconnect it...not worth the trouble. I’ve come to realize the internet of things is not for me on things like light switches.
customer_reviews.author: Max from Utah

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this switch. I had some challenges installing them in a multi switch gang box but overall I am very happy. One thing is the function of the switch turn off and on producers a loud click. When I as Alexa to turn off all switch’s you can hear one big click. Other than that I totally approve of and recommend this item! I will be keeping with Leviton for all my smart switch and plug needs
customer_reviews.author: @JoshParkinRing

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Switch on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several different Leviton Decora Smart Wi-Fi switches, from dimmers to multi-way switches. I originally chose Leviton Decora Smart Wi-Fi switches as they are the only switches that support more than 3-way switching, I needed 4-way for my setup, and have since gone to the Leviton Decora line for all my smart switches and outlets for my Alexa smart home integration. The only hard thing with multi-way switches is finding the last switch before the light. that switch will be the main switch with all the other "way" switches being the follower switches but other than that, install is easy.
customer_reviews.author: MartensCal

customer_reviews.title: Better than wemo
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a solid product that does what you would expect. I purchased this switch to replace a wemo dimmer that kept freezing. Several months later i have no complaints. The switch was easy to install (i am comfortable with basic wiring but by no means an electrician). Wifi setup was easy and has not had any connectivity issues. I frequently use the switch with IFTTT and daily with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: tractadude90

customer_reviews.title: Simple install, easy programming, over a year of great service.
customer_reviews.text: I have both the 600 watt and the 1000watt models. The 600 watt dimmer has been in use for well over a year and has worked flawlessly. We added more string lights so I upgrade it to a 1000 watt dimmer which installed easily and programmed the first time without a glitch. The 600 watt unit now controls the dining room lighting and my sweetheart(and Alexa) couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Spearhead

customer_reviews.title: Cant connect to cloud - USER error - these are great!
customer_reviews.text: Gets stuck on step 6 can't connect to My Leviton Cloud. Tech wasn't able to assist - was so looking forward to these (I bought 2) now have to return. Update! I changed my rating to excellent - David from tech support assisted me - was a simple password error on my end. If you get to step 6 of 7, double check your passwords. Thank you David!
customer_reviews.author: RSal

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 1 year to the day
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year to date, the occasional “freezing” of the switch (where there is no response either remotely or physical) has now turned into a daily occurrence effectively making this switch unusable and forcing me to turn the breaker off to this switch every day. I have 4 other switches and 2 dimmers which so far seem to be working properly, we’ll see how long they’ll last as this damaged one was the first of the bunch as a tester. At over $50 at the time, I expected to get more than a year’s worth. I have to say while they work, they are a great convenience, especially when paired through the amazon echo.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo L

customer_reviews.title: Works with smartthings
customer_reviews.text: I had an area that no matter how close I got my smartthings z-wave hub too it, the performance of the z-wave switch was unreliable. So I bought this instead. After a really difficult time (and 2 tech support calls) getting it paired, I was easily able to integrate it with my smartthings and Alexa sarthome ecosystem. The delay to turn off other devices talking to my hub is slightly slower than my other z-wave switches but still below 1 second. The delay to turn those same devices on is still very slow. It's possible this has to do with the other devices and not the switch. So far I'm relatively happy.
customer_reviews.author: Asthmatic Smokey the Bear

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I lived without them
customer_reviews.text: I have devices all over the house that work with Alexa. I think it is making me lazy. I have 4 of Leviton DW6HD-1BZ Decora Smart Wi-Fi 600W Incandescent/300W LED Dimmer, and 3 of Leviton DD00R-DLZ 120VAC 60 Hz Decora Digital/Decora Smart Matching Dimmer Remote. It is so nice when a light is left on in the basement, I can turn it off by telling Alexa to do so. I have created Groups and can turn off all lights at once. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Henry B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible setup program
customer_reviews.text: This product has a absolute horrible setup feature! I do home automation and use multiple products and this has been the most frustrating setup I've ever encountered. Just about any product requires a sign in feature with account then your set to connect to a hub,Alexa,Google home...etc,etc.....I sat and messed with this for over an hour and still no luck at all.
customer_reviews.author: A. Amber

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability, 2 out of 5 fails in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have installed 5 of those switches about a year ago. 2 of them failed in first 6 months. They stuck in open (ON), and cannot be turned off either manually or via app. In app it shows connected and while they cycle between on/off the green light on button turn off and on, indicating wifi working, but no clicking sound from relay that engage power for the switch. I have sent a support email to Leviton, no answer yet. While working they worked well. But I will be reluctant putting any more of those switches due to reliability issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bells

customer_reviews.title: No hub required Hooray
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy a product that works . I threw my wink hub out now that they are charging a subscription . I bought the Samsung smart hub and both ones kept disconnecting and reconnecting from my network. Useless tech support so I broke down decided to buy this switch no hub required and it’s friggin amazing . Works great put my outdoor lights on a schedule seamless integration with Alexa and so easy to set up . Best of all was the cheapest of all my options could not be happier . Highly recommend this product .
customer_reviews.author: Mg

customer_reviews.title: The plug works great. I have a pair of Lamps on my ...
customer_reviews.text: The plug works great. I have a pair of Lamps on my desk and wanted to control them as a single item using LED lamps rated at 100 Watts. I am old and I still think of my lights in wattage. The directions for pairing up with the Amazon echo were clear And accurate. It was very difficult to find a plug with dimming capability and this function works great with the lamps. I will not hesitate to buy the plugt again as I sort out my system in the house
customer_reviews.author: Wildflecken

customer_reviews.title: Please avoid these
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst. I have had these over a year now and I wish that I had never bought these. They were very expensive and extremely difficult to install. The technicians are good that you have to call but these are definitely not worth the hassle. They always reset and are offline. I have to keep resetting them by turning off my breakers at the circuit panel. I cannot remember a time when any of them worked properly all at one time. I have 13 of them and would love to return them all and get my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, will buy more
customer_reviews.text: I love the wifi dimmer switches. First, I have zero experience doing electrical work and I was able to install the switch easily with the help of YouTube instruction videos. Second the integration with Google home was easy. I can ask Google to do things with the lights and it does. Third it is easy to set up timers on the app. I haven't turned on our off my porch light in ages.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Dimming works great.
customer_reviews.text: Leviton DW6HD-1BZ Decora Smart Wi-Fi 600W works very well with my retro fit led can lights in my basement. The dimming is great even at 1 percent brightness with no issues unlike other smart dimmers I have tried. This smart switch also has a rocker to turn on and off lights manually, as well as, dim lights manually as well. This is a very nice feature if your internet goes down for any reason. The switch looks very nice, functions well, and stays connected to my wifi with no issues. Love this product and will be buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: j dog

customer_reviews.title: Best smart switch option! Easy to use and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: These switches have been great. I’ve installed numerous dimmer and non-dimmer switches. They are easy to install (just like replacing a regular switch) and the app works great. I have some other off brand ones where the app and setup are much harder and confusing. The Leviton switches took me no time at all to set up. I also like that they have many different types of smart switches that all work with the same app. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it allows me to set timed schedules for turning on/off my outdoor lighting. Negates the need for special light bulbs, dusk/dawn sensors, etc. One simple switch does it all. It is easy to install, the app for my Android easy to use (for my purposes) and for the price, a solid buy and solid value. Oh yes, if you purchase the Levitron Smart Plugin outlet you can add it to the same app and control outlets too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L. Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not so clear, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are frustratingly unclear for the 3 way. A few online videos helped me through the process (highly recommend researching yourself first). On top of that, I had a bad switch that had me thinking I was doing something wrong on my end for three days. But I was able to return and get a new one, which fired up on my first attempt. Once I got it going, haven't had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Piggott

customer_reviews.title: Great product for timing lights
customer_reviews.text: I installed three in a single box with three gang plate. Worked very well, though these are bigger than “traditional” switches so had to buy and install a new box as well (which is time consuming and may be beyond capabilities of some do-it-yourselfers). I love how I can control any combination of the lights using the app. Makes for really beautiful - and practical lighting in front of the house!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Leggett

customer_reviews.title: couldn't get to work.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed at Leviton, not because I couldn't get this to light up on a LED setting( 6x27W) (I assume i didn't install properly, so let's wait for the electrician to finish), but for poor instructions, confusing videos and lack of tech. support knowledge, no where nor any time one is told that this unit is required to pair with another (DW6HD) product. Over the phone I was not even told this is also a dimmer (who needs 2 in a regular household). Let's see if I can revise this review later. If doesn't work I'm stuck with no possibility of return
customer_reviews.author: Nilson

customer_reviews.title: Working great for home automation and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I've installed three of these switches (so far). One is used (via Alexa routine) to turn on conventional outdoor at night when the Ring camera detects motion. This provides more light when I get home late and helps dicourage intruders. Another switch is set up similarly so the patio lights turn on when I (or the dog) goes outside. I can also control the switches with Alexa voice commands. Installation documentation was very good; the app helped simplify installation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very easy iPhone app setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy iPhone app setup. I paired this with the Leviton DD00R-DLZ unit to have dimmers at both switches in our bedroom. I paired these wall switches with 9 LED "can" lights (they don't really have cans but when installed in a 4 inch hole they look like a can-type fixture). When you turn off the lights they dim until they go out. When you turn on the lights they ramp up to the last dimmer setting you had when they were turned on. This is exactly what I wanted the lights to do. I gave it four stars because of the price. OUCH! These things should not be nearly this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Neighbour

customer_reviews.title: They don't tell you everything.
customer_reviews.text: After installing this switch my lights flickered every time I turned them up or down. After reading online Leviton has a bulb compatibility list they don't advertise when selling their switch. After filtering down the list to the type of bulb we use, I was unable to find the compatible bulbs anywhere! I tried several retailers to match the model numbers and found nothing. The lack of information upfront and the limited bulb manufactures that this device is compatible with is discouraging. I will be returning the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Works perfectly with Alexa!  Leviton app is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Love this smart wall switch! Works perfectly with Alexa. The Leviton app is wonderful! Very nice interface, easy to use, and very intuitive. I plan to buy many more of these along with other smart Leviton devices. The only negatives I can say are that the price of the Leviton smart devices is a little high compared to other good smart devices offered by other companies, and that Leviton has limited smart devices available at this time. Once they offer more smart devices, things will be great!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: 3 way only with their $21 remote switch
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that this device required no hub and directly connected wirelessly. The app is decent though I have had some variance in the fade setting where the light just shuts off sometimes. The reason for 3 stars is the fact that it states "single pole vs. three way compatible". After playing around with the wiring I read the fine print. You cannot use a standard 3 way switch on the other end of the line, you need to use DDOOR-DL remote switch for another $21 bucks, so it becomes almost a $70 dollar investment. I would give this a 4 or 5 if the description was clear.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, turn the lights to 10% - and they dim over 2 seconds to that exact level. So cool!
customer_reviews.text: This took my home theater to the next notch. No more getting everything set up and then walking across the room to dim the lights. I just tell Alexa what level I want and like magic, they slowly dim or brighten to my requested level. It's just a dimmer, so hey, I can't get too excited, but I must say, it's pretty cool. Super easy to install, replacing the existing dimmer and set-up with the app was fast and simple. I can easily recommend this smart dimmer. Lots of control over how it dims, the min and max it can reach. Nice set-up overall.
customer_reviews.author: MikeReedKS

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these switches - 2 regular, 2 dimmer - installed them ... in single and 3way - none of them work. I got wifi signal ... they registered on the app, but did they control lights? Nope. Nothing. Manual and app control did not work. Also tried them on conventional and LED fixtures. Still - nothing. Complete garbage. I'm surprised the Leviton name is on this Made in China junk. No wonder these were so cheap. Stick with Lutron for working electronic light controls.
customer_reviews.author: Kasem O

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me! Bought a second after the first worked so well!
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be a great addition to my house. It was easy to install, set up and now is a great way to control lighting without hard wiring additional switches, which is costly and difficult. Improves the safety of coming home in the dark now that we are entering daylight savings time.
customer_reviews.author: Mt Sun Gear

customer_reviews.title: I have these in every room of my house!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have them in every room of my house. I also have one in my kitchen, dining room and living room. I use it with Alexa. Setting them up with Alexa is not that bad. Once you do one switch it is super easy for each additional switch. What I really love is Alexa can set up groups. So I can tell Alexa to turn off all house lights and she will. Or I can say turn off all bedroom lights because my family doesn't know how to turn lights off. If you are watching a movie you can have Alexa dim the lights to 10% to enjoy the movie.
customer_reviews.author: mugs

customer_reviews.title: Alexa,  Let there be light!!!
customer_reviews.text: I considered several options before going with Leviton, and I do not regret it. I've got 5 switches, 2 plug-in modules and 2 dimmers. They are easy to install (with basic electrical knowledge) and when you run into a problem, you call the support line and they'll talk you off the ledge. Oh, and the warranty is pretty impressive as well. I had an issue with one of the switches and after troubleshooting with their support line, got a replacement in the mail in a couple of days. These switches are reliable and easy to manage from their app or with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to setup and works exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I know this works well with Alexa, but have not seen many reviews regarding google home. I guess since this is an amazon review, that is to be expected. Well I gave it a shot and it works perfectly with google home. Was easy to setup and works exactly as expected. Now if only I could get the rest of my family to obey my commands...
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Starts to fail after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Put these in living room, kitchen, dining room bedrooms, and bathrooms. They work great and are easy to set up. The flaw I am now running into is they burn out. Had them in for about a year and now, one by one they are failing and I am having to replace them. Very frustrating to replace a switch that never had to be replaced but now since it's a "smart" switch I'm going to be replacing them once a year it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B

customer_reviews.title: Read my Technical Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I did tons of research on phone controlled wifi switches. Leviton definitely was the way to go. They have the best family of products that works extremely well. Their app has had some low ratings but it works great for me. (Leviton put a great deal of work into improving it recently)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Barsamian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE these switches
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE these switches. I installed them in two locations in my house. One controls 8 recessed LED light fixtures in the living room and the other controls an outdoor LED light fixture. So far no issues with connection to the WiFi and works flawlessly with my Echo and Google Home devices.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Padilla

product_meta.title: Leviton DW3HL-1BW Decora Smart Wi-Fi Plug-In Dimmer, No Hub Required, Works with Alexa and Google Assistant, White
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Style:Plug-in DimmerStart automating and controlling your plug-in lamps using the Decora Smart Wi-Fi plug-in outlet. Use the free My Leviton iOS or Android app to add/name devices and to control them individually or as a room with a single button push. Create schedules, scenes and customize your experience with adjustable fade rates, maximum/minimum illumination levels and more if desired. Add an Alexa or Google Assistant device to use voice commands like, "Alexa, turn the table lamp to 65%". Rated for LED and CFL loads up to 100-Watt and incandescent loads up to 300-Watt, no new wiring required. A five year limited supports Decora smart Wi-Fi products. Decora Smart devices are designed for countries which follow NEMA standards including the United States, Canada and parts of South America.
feature_bullets: No Hub: Control your home from anywhere via My Leviton app - simply plug in a lamp and dim or brighten via app, voice, or schedule.

Capabilities: Schedule lights to adjust when you want including sunrise/sunset, easily create lighting scenes, utilize auto-shutoff feature and vacation (randomization) mode. Easy Wi-Fi lighting for your whole home
Voice control: Works with Alexa and Google Assistant voice assistants (sold separately). “Alexa, turn floor lamp to 33%.”
Works with: IFTTT, SmartThings, August, Alexa, Google Assistant and more.
Very smart: Leviton devices are truly smart – your pre-set schedules live inside each device, so your schedules always run as expected.
Ratings: Dimmable LED and CFL up to 100W and Incandescent up to 300W. Ideal for table, floor, or hanging lamps to brighten or dim via voice, schedule, or app.
Leviton: Making your home smarter and safer since 1906. Designed, engineered, and supported in USA with a 5-year limited.
